1.text: After these things hath the word of Jehovah been unto Abram in a vision, saying, ‘Fear not, Abram, I am a shield to thee, thy reward is exceeding great.’

2.text: And Abram saith, ‘Lord Jehovah, what dost Thou give to me, and I am going childless? and an acquired son in my house is Demmesek Eliezer.’

3.text: And Abram saith, ‘Lo, to me Thou hast not given seed, and lo, a domestic doth heir me.’

4.text: And lo, the word of Jehovah is unto him, saying, ‘This one doth not heir thee; but he who cometh out from thy bowels, he doth heir thee;’

5.text: and He bringeth him out without, and saith, ‘Look attentively, I pray thee, towards the heavens, and count the stars, if thou art able to count them;’ and He saith to him, ‘Thus is thy seed.’

6.text: And he hath believed in Jehovah, and He reckoneth it to him—righteousness.

7.text: And He saith unto him, ‘I am Jehovah who brought thee out from Ur of the Chaldees, to give to thee this land to possess it;’

8.text: and he saith, ‘Lord Jehovah, whereby do I know that I possess it?’

9.text: And He saith unto him, ‘Take for Me a heifer of three years, and a she-goat of three years, and a ram of three years, and a turtle-dove, and a young bird;’

10.text: and he taketh to him all these, and separateth them in the midst, and putteth each piece over against its fellow, but the bird he hath not divided;

11.text: and the ravenous birds come down upon the carcases, and Abram causeth them to turn back.

12.text: And the sun is about to go in, and deep sleep hath fallen upon Abram, and lo, a terror of great darkness is falling upon him;

13.text: and He saith to Abram, ‘knowing—know that thy seed is a sojourner in a land not theirs, and they have served them, and they have afflicted them four hundred years,

14.text: and the nation also whom they serve I judge, and after this they go out with great substance;

15.text: and thou—thou comest in unto thy fathers in peace; thou art buried in a good old age;

16.text: and the fourth generation doth turn back hither, for the iniquity of the Amorite is not yet complete.’

17.text: And it cometh to pass—the sun hath gone in, and thick darkness hath been—and lo, a furnace of smoke, and a lamp of fire, which hath passed over between those pieces.

18.text: In that day hath Jehovah made with Abram a covenant, saying, ‘To thy seed I have given this land, from the river of Egypt unto the great river, the river Phrat,

19.text: with the Kenite, and the Kenizzite, and the Kadmonite,

20.text: and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Rephaim,

21.text: and the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Girgashite, and the Jebusite.’
